sen.j: 長命寺（ちょうめいじ）は、滋賀県近江八幡市にある寺院。
sen.e: Chomei-ji Temple is located in Omihachiman City, Shiga Prefecture.
Chomei-ji Temple is located in Omihachiman City, Shiga Prefecture.
Chomei-ji Temple is located in Omihachiman City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は姨綺耶山（いきやさん）。

The Sango (Temple's title) is Ikiyasan.

sen.e: Independent branch of the Tendai sect
Independent branch of the Tendai sect
Independent branch of the Tendai sect

sen.j: 聖徳太子の開基と伝える。
sen.e: It has been said that Kaiki is Prince Shotoku.
It has been said that Kaiki is Prince Shotoku.
It has been said that Kaiki is Prince Shotoku.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 琵琶湖畔にそびえる長命寺山の山腹に位置し、麓から本堂に至る800段余の長い階段で知られる。
sen.e: It is located on the mountainside of Chomeiji hill by Lake Biwa, and has been known for more than 800 steps leading from foot of the hill to Hondo.
It is located on the mountainside of Chomeiji hill by Lake Biwa, and has been known for its more than 800 steps leading from the foot of the hill to Hondo.
It is located on the mountainside of Chomeiji hill by Lake Biwa, and has been known for its more than 800 steps leading from the foot of the hill to Hondo.

sen.j: かつての巡礼者は、船で長命寺に参詣した。
sen.e: Ancient pilgrims visited Chomei-ji Temple for prayer by ship.
Ancient pilgrims visited Chomei-ji Temple for prayer by ship.
Ancient pilgrims visited Chomei-ji Temple for prayer by ship.

sen.j: 伝承によれば、第12代景行天皇の時代に、武内宿禰がこの地で柳の木に「寿命長遠諸元成就」と彫り長寿を祈願した。
sen.e: According to legend, during the twelfth Emperor Keiko era, TAKENOUCHI no Sukune curved '寿命長遠諸元成就' (wishing for long life) in a willow tree wishing for longevity.
sen.cmt: 寿命長遠諸元成就: '寿命長遠諸元成就' (wishing for long life) と訳しました。
sen.e: According to legend, during the twelfth Emperor Keiko era, TAKENOUCHI no Sukune carved '寿命長遠諸元成就' (wishing for long life) in a willow tree wishing for longevity.
According to legend, during the twelfth Emperor Keiko era, TAKENOUCHI no Sukune carved '寿命長遠諸元成就' (wishing for long life) in a willow tree wishing for longevity.

sen.j: このため宿禰は300歳の長命を保ったと伝えられる。
sen.e: It has been said that this gave Sukune a long life of 300 years.
It has been said that this gave Sukune a long life of 300 years.
It has been said that this gave Sukune a long life of 300 years.

sen.j: その後、聖徳太子がこの地に赴いた際、宿禰が祈願した際に彫った文字を発見したという。
sen.e: It is said that when Prince Shotoku visited the place later, he found the letters Sukune had curved at his pray.
It is said that when Prince Shotoku visited the place later, he found the letters Sukune had carved during his prayer.
It is said that when Prince Shotoku visited the place later, he found the letters Sukune had carved during his prayer.

sen.j: これに感銘を受けてながめていると白髪の老人が現れ、その木で仏像を彫りこの地に安置するよう告げた。
sen.e: When he was impressed by them and looking at them, a white-haired old man appeared and told him to make a Buddha statue out of the wood and enshrine it here.
Looking at them, he was impressed, and a white-haired old man appeared and told him to make a Buddha statue out of the wood and enshrine it.
Looking at them, he was impressed, and a white-haired old man appeared and told him to make a Buddha statue out of the wood and enshrine it.

sen.j: 太子は早速、十一面観音を彫りこの地に安置した。
sen.e: The Prince immediately made Eleven-faced Kannon and enshrined it here.
The Prince immediately made the Eleven-faced Kannon and enshrined it at that very spot.
The Prince immediately made the Eleven-faced Kannon and enshrined it at that very spot.

sen.j: 太子は宿禰の長寿にあやかり、当寺を長命寺と名付けたと伝えられている。
sen.e: It has been said that the Prince named the temple Chomei-ji Temple after Sukune's longevity.
It has been said that the Prince named the temple Chomei-ji Temple after Sukune's longevity.
It has been said that the Prince named the temple Chomei-ji Temple after Sukune's longevity.

sen.j: その名の通り、参拝すると長生きすると言い伝えられている。
sen.e: As the name says, it is said that if you visit the temple to pray, you will live a long life.
As the name says, it is said that if you visit the temple to pray, you will live a long life.
As the name says, it is said that if you visit the temple to pray, you will live a long life.

sen.j: 実際の創建年次や創建の事情については未詳であり、確実な史料における長命寺の初見は、承保元年（1074年）3月2日付の「奥島庄司土師宿禰助正解文」（おくしましょうじ はじのすくねすけまさ げぶみ）という文書である。
sen.e: The actual year and circumferences of the foundation are unknown, and description of Chomei-ji Temple in reliable historical materials first appears in monjo (written material) called "Letters of HAJI no Sukune Sukemasa, Okushima no Shoji (administrator of a manor) dated March 2, 1074.

The actual year and circumferences of the foundation are unknown, and a description of Chomei-ji Temple according to reliable historical materials first appears in monjo (written material) called "Letters of HAJI no Sukune Sukemasa, Okushima no Shoji (administrator of a manor) dated March 2, 1074.

The actual year and circumferences of the foundation are unknown, and a description of Chomei-ji Temple according to reliable historical materials first appears in monjo (written material) called 'Letters of HAJI no Sukune Sukemasa, Okushima no Shoji (administrator of a manor)' dated March 2, 1074.

tit.e: honzon (principal object of worship at a temple)
Honzon (principal object of worship at a temple)
Honzon (principal object of worship at a temple)

sen.j: 「千手十一面聖観世音菩薩三尊一体」、つまり、千手観音、十一面観音、聖観音（しょうかんのん）の3体が長命寺の本尊であるとされている。
sen.e: It is said that Chomei-ji Temple's honzon is 'the trinity of Three Buddhas,' i.e. three Kannons called Senju Kannon, Eleven-faced Kannon, and Sho Kannon.
It is said that Chomei-ji Temple's honzon is 'the trinity of Three Buddhas,' i.e. three Kannons called Senju Kannon, Eleven-faced Kannon, and Sho Kannon.
It is said that Chomei-ji Temple's honzon is 'the trinity of Three Buddhas,' i.e. three Kannons called Senju Kannon, Eleven-faced Kannon, and Sho Kannon.

sen.j: 本堂内陣の厨子には、中央に千手観音像、向かって右に十一面観音像、左に聖観音像が安置されている（いずれも重要文化財、秘仏）。
sen.e: In a zushi (a cupboard-like case with double doors in which an image of (the) Buddha, a sutra, or some other revered object is kept at a temple) in the main temple, Senju Kannon zo (statue of Thousand Armed Avalokiteshwara) is located in the center, Juichimen Kannon-zo (the statue of Eleven-faced Kannon) on the observer's right, and Sho Kannon zo (statue of Sho Kannon) on the observer's left (all of them are important cultural properties and Buddhist images normally withheld from public view).

In a zushi (a cupboard-like case with double doors in which an image of (the) Buddha, a sutra, or some other revered object is kept at a temple) in the main temple, Senju Kannon zo (statue of Thousand Armed Avalokiteshwara) is located in the center, Juichimen Kannon-zo (the statue of Eleven-faced Kannon) on the observer's right, and Sho Kannon zo (statue of Sho Kannon) on the observer's left (all of them are important cultural properties and Buddhist images normally withheld from public view).

In a zushi (a cupboard-like case with double doors in which an image of (the) Buddha, a sutra, or some other revered object is kept at a temple) in the main temple, Senju Kannon zo (statue of Thousand Armed Avalokiteshwara) is located in the center, Juichimen Kannon-zo (the statue of Eleven-faced Kannon) on the observer's right, and Sho Kannon zo (statue of Sho Kannon) on the observer's left (all of them are important cultural properties and Buddhist images normally withheld from public view).

sen.j: 千手観音像（像高91.8cm）は一木割矧造、素地截金仕上げで、平安時代末期、12世紀頃の作と推定される。
sen.e: Senju Kannon zo is made with the split-and-join method using wooden blocks from one tree with saikin (cut gold leaf) finishing applied to its groundwork, and it is estimated that it was created about in the end of Heian Period, the 12th century.

Senju Kannon zo is made with the split-and-join method using wooden blocks from one tree with saikin (cut gold leaf) finishing applied to its groundwork, and it is estimated that it was created during the end of Heian Period, in the 12th century.

Senju Kannon zo (statue height: 91.8 cm) is made with the split-and-join method using wooden blocks from one tree with saikin (cut gold leaf) finishing applied to its groundwork, and it is estimated that it was created during the end of Heian Period, in the 12th century.

sen.j: 十一面観音像（像高53.8cm）は、千手観音像より古い10世紀ないし11世紀の作と推定され、こちらが当初の本尊であった可能性もある。
sen.e: It is estimated that Juichimen Kannon-zo (statue height: 53.8 cm) was created earlier than Senju Kannon zo in 10th or 11th century, and there is a possibility that this was originally honzon.

It is estimated that Juichimen Kannon-zo (statue height: 53.8 cm) was created earlier than Senju Kannon zo during the 10th or 11th century, and there is a possibility that this was the original honzon.

It is estimated that Juichimen Kannon-zo (statue height: 53.8 cm) was created earlier than Senju Kannon zo during the 10th or 11th century, and there is a possibility that this was the original honzon.

sen.j: 聖観音像（像高67.4cm）は鎌倉時代の作と推定される。
sen.e: It is estimated that Sho Kannon zo (statue height: 67.4 cm) is a work in Kamakura Period.
It is estimated that Sho Kannon zo (statue height: 67.4 cm) is a work from the Kamakura Period.
It is estimated that Sho Kannon zo (statue height: 67.4 cm) is a work from the Kamakura period.

sen.j: これらの像を安置する厨子は前の間と後の間に区分され、後の間には地蔵菩薩立像と薬師如来立像を安置する。
sen.e: A zushi in which these statues are enshrined is divided into the front room and the rear room, and Jizo Bosatsu ryuzo (standing statue of the Guardian Deity of Travelers and Children) and Yakushi Nyorai ryuzo (standing statue of Bhaisajyaguru) are enshrined in the rear room.

A zushi in which these statues are enshrined is divided into the front room and the rear room, and Jizo Bosatsu ryuzo (standing statue of the Guardian Deity of Travelers and Children) and Yakushi Nyorai ryuzo (standing statue of Bhaisajyaguru) are enshrined in the rear room.

A zushi in which these statues are enshrined is divided into the front room and the rear room, and Jizo Bosatsu ryuzo (standing statue of the Guardian Deity of Travelers and Children) and Yakushi Nyorai ryuzo (standing statue of Bhaisajyaguru) are enshrined in the rear room.

sen.j: 西国三十三所巡礼に関する確実な史料で最古のものとされる『寺門高僧記』所収の行尊の巡礼記（11世紀末頃）では長命寺の本尊を「三尺千手」としており、同じく『寺門高僧記』所収の覚忠の巡礼記（応保元年・1161年）では本尊を「三尺聖観音」とするなど、古い時代に本尊が入れ替わっていることが記録から伺える。
sen.e: In the record of pilgrimage of Gyoson (about the end of 11th century) in "The Record of High Priest at A Temple" which has been regarded as the oldest reliable historical materials regarding Saigoku Sanju-san-ka-sho pilgrimage, honzon of Chomei-ji Temple is 'short Senju', and in the record of pilgrimage of Kakucyu (in 1161) also in "The Record of High Priest at A Temple", honzon is regarded as 'short Sho Kannon', so it is obvious from the records that honzon was replaced in the old days.

In the record of pilgrimage of Gyoson (about the end of 11th century) in "The Record of High Priest at A Temple" which has been regarded as the oldest reliable historical material regarding Saigoku Sanju-san-ka-sho pilgrimage, the honzon of Chomei-ji Temple is 'short Senju', and in the record of pilgrimage of Kakucyu (in 1161) also in "The Record of High Priest at A Temple", the honzon is regarded as 'short Sho Kannon', so it is obvious from the records that the honzon was replaced in the past.

In the record of pilgrimage of Gyoson (about the end of 11th century) in "The Record of High Priest at A Temple" which has been regarded as the oldest reliable historical material regarding Saigoku Sanju-san-ka-sho pilgrimage, the honzon of Chomei-ji Temple is 'short Senju', and in the record of pilgrimage of Kakuchu (in 1161) also in "The Record of High Priest at A Temple," the honzon is regarded as 'short Sho Kannon,' so it is obvious from the records that the honzon was replaced in the past.
sen.cmt: カンマ位置移動しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: これらの観音像は厳重な秘仏とされ、平素は公開されていない。
sen.e: These Kannon-zo are strictly regarded as Buddhist images normally withheld from public view.
These Kannon-zo are strictly regarded as Buddhist images normally withheld from public view.
These Kannon-zo are strictly regarded as Buddhist images normally withheld from public view.

sen.j: 西国三十三所観音巡礼の中興者とされる花山法皇の一千年忌を記念して2008年から2010年にかけて、西国三十三所の各札所寺院で「結縁開帳」が行われることとなり、長命寺の本尊は2009年10月1日から10月31日の間、開扉されることとなった。
sen.e: In celebration of the 1,000th anniversary of Cloistered Emperor Kazan who are regarded as a person who restored Saigoku Sanju-san-ka-sho (Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage), it was decided to hold 'Kechien kaicho' (unveiling a Buddhist image to make a connection with Buddha) from 2008 to 2010 and honzon of Chomei-ji Temple was going to be opened to the public from October 1 through October 31, 2009.

In celebration of the 1,000th anniversary of Cloistered Emperor Kazan who is regarded as a person who restored Saigoku Sanju-san-ka-sho (Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage), 'Kechien kaicho' (unveiling a Buddhist image to make a connection with Buddha) was decided to be held from 2008 to 2010 and that the honzon of Chomei-ji Temple would be opened to the public from October 1 through October 31, 2009.

In celebration of the 1,000th anniversary of Cloistered Emperor Kazan who is regarded as a person who restored Saigoku Sanju-san-ka-sho (Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage), 'Kechien kaicho' (unveiling a Buddhist image to make a connection with Buddha) was decided to be held from 2008 to 2010 and that the honzon of Chomei-ji Temple would be opened to the public from October 1 through October 31, 2009.

sen.j: これは1948年以来、61年ぶりの開扉である。
sen.e: 61 years have passed since the last open day in 1948.
61 years have passed since it was last exhibited in 1948.
61 years have passed since it was last exhibited in 1948.
